intro: Centaurea wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in dense, spherical heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Centaurea wallichiana is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
